title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 11.

questions.question: How many chosen men did Rehoboam gather from Judah and Benjamin to fight against Israel?
questions.explanation: Rehoboam gathered an hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men according to 2 Chronicles 11:1.

questions.question: Who received the word of the LORD to speak to Rehoboam and the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Shemaiah
questions.explanation: The word of the LORD came to Shemaiah the man of God to speak to Rehoboam as stated in 2 Chronicles 11:2.

questions.question: What did the LORD command Rehoboam and the people of Judah and Benjamin regarding going to fight against Israel?
options: Do not go or fight against your brethren
questions.correctAnswer: Do not go or fight against your brethren
questions.explanation: The LORD said they shall not go up nor fight against their brethren but return to their houses as seen in 2 Chronicles 11:4.

questions.question: Which city did Rehoboam dwell in after returning from war?
questions.correctAnswer: Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem after the events described, according to 2 Chronicles 11:5.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the cities Rehoboam built or fortified for defense?
questions.correctAnswer: Jericho
questions.explanation: Jericho is not listed among the cities Rehoboam built or fortified in 2 Chronicles 11:6-10.

questions.question: What did Rehoboam put in every city to prepare for defense?
questions.correctAnswer: Shields and spears
questions.explanation: Rehoboam put shields and spears in every city making them very strong as stated in 2 Chronicles 11:12.

questions.question: Why did the priests and Levites come to Judah and Jerusalem?
options: Because Jeroboam cast them off from priestly duties
questions.correctAnswer: Because Jeroboam cast them off from priestly duties
questions.explanation: They came because Jeroboam and his sons cast them off from executing the priest's office, as described in 2 Chronicles 11:14.

questions.question: What kind of priests did Jeroboam ordain?
options: Priests for the high places and the calves he made
questions.correctAnswer: Priests for the high places and the calves he made
questions.explanation: Jeroboam ordained priests for the high places, the devils, and the calves which he had made, according to 2 Chronicles 11:15.

questions.question: For how many years did the people walk in the way of David and Solomon, strengthening Rehoboam's kingdom?
questions.correctAnswer: Three years
questions.explanation: They walked in the way of David and Solomon for three years, strengthening Rehoboam's kingdom as per 2 Chronicles 11:17.

questions.question: Who was Rehoboam's wife that was the daughter of Jerimoth, son of David?
questions.correctAnswer: Mahalath
questions.explanation: Rehoboam took Mahalath, daughter of Jerimoth son of David, as wife according to 2 Chronicles 11:18.

questions.question: True or False: Rehoboam had only one wife according to this chapter.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Rehoboam had eighteen wives and sixty concubines as stated in 2 Chronicles 11:21.

questions.question: True or False: Rehoboam loved Maachah, daughter of Absalom, more than all his other wives and concubines.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Rehoboam loved Maachah above all his wives and concubines according to 2 Chronicles 11:21.

questions.question: True or False: Rehoboam made Abijah, son of Maachah, chief ruler among his brothers.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Rehoboam made Abijah chief to be ruler among his brethren as found in 2 Chronicles 11:22.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And he fortified the strong holds, and put captains in them, and store of victual, and of oil and ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: wine
questions.explanation: The verse 2 Chronicles 11:11 mentions Rehoboam stored victual, oil, and wine in the strong holds.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah the chief, to be ______ among his brethren.'
questions.correctAnswer: ruler
questions.explanation: Rehoboam made Abijah the chief, to be ruler among his brethren as in 2 Chronicles 11:22.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with anger towards a brother in Christ who disagrees with them. Based on 2 Chronicles 11, what biblical truth would you share about reconciliation?
options: Do not fight against your brethren, for this is God's will
Seek revenge to prove your strength
Ignore your brother until he apologizes
Gather a large army to show your power
questions.correctAnswer: Do not fight against your brethren, for this is God's will
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:4 shows that God commanded Rehoboam and his people not to fight against their brethren because this was His doing. This teaches us to pursue peace and reconciliation rather than conflict.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 11 teach about trusting God's plan when facing difficult decisions?
options: Obey God's word even if it means not fighting
Act according to your own strength and wisdom
Ignore God's instructions to assert control
Wait for others to make the first move
questions.correctAnswer: Obey God's word even if it means not fighting
questions.explanation: The chapter shows that when God spoke through Shemaiah, Rehoboam obeyed and did not fight Israel (2 Chronicles 11:2-4). This demonstrates trusting God's guidance over personal desires.

questions.question: What does Rehoboam’s building and fortifying of cities teach us about stewardship and preparation in our responsibilities?
options: Be diligent and wise in preparing for challenges
Ignore practical needs and rely only on faith
Leave everything to chance and avoid work
questions.correctAnswer: Be diligent and wise in preparing for challenges
questions.explanation: Rehoboam built and fortified cities with supplies and appointed captains (2 Chronicles 11:5-12), showing responsible stewardship and wise preparation in leadership and life.

questions.question: A believer feels isolated because others have rejected their sincere worship. What encouragement does 2 Chronicles 11 provide about remaining faithful?
options: Those who sincerely seek God will find fellowship
Give up worship to avoid rejection
Change your beliefs to fit in
Worship only in secret to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Those who sincerely seek God will find fellowship
questions.explanation: The Levites and others who sought the LORD came to Rehoboam in Judah for worship (2 Chronicles 11:13-16), showing that genuine devotion leads to fellowship despite rejection elsewhere.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 11 emphasize the importance of godly leadership in family life?
options: Rehoboam appointed his son Abijah as chief to lead among his brothers
Children should be ignored in leadership matters
Only outsiders should be given leadership roles
Leadership should be given to the strongest, regardless of family
questions.correctAnswer: Rehoboam appointed his son Abijah as chief to lead among his brothers
questions.explanation: Verse 22 shows Rehoboam making Abijah chief among his brothers, highlighting the role of wise parental guidance and leadership within the family.

questions.question: What does Rehoboam’s distribution of his children into the fortified cities teach us about wise parenting and responsibility?
options: Disperse children to places of responsibility with provision
Keep all children together without roles
questions.correctAnswer: Disperse children to places of responsibility with provision
questions.explanation: Verse 23 shows Rehoboam wisely placing his children in various cities with victuals, teaching the value of preparing children for responsibility and supporting them.

questions.question: What spiritual discipline is illustrated by those who left their possessions to serve God in Judah and Jerusalem?
options: Sacrificing personal comfort to serve the Lord
Avoiding responsibilities to focus on worship
questions.correctAnswer: Sacrificing personal comfort to serve the Lord
questions.explanation: Verses 13-14 describe the Levites leaving their homes and possessions to serve God, showing dedication and sacrifice as a spiritual discipline.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 11, Rehoboam obeyed God's command not to fight his brethren and returned home in peace.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 4 explicitly states that Rehoboam and the people obeyed God’s command and returned without fighting, demonstrating obedience and trust.

questions.question: True or False: The chapter shows that Rehoboam neglected the defense of his kingdom and left cities unprotected.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Rehoboam built and fortified many cities, appointed captains, and stocked supplies (2 Chronicles 11:5-12), showing diligent defense and leadership.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 11 teach about humility and contentment in spiritual leadership?
options: Leaders obey God’s word even when it limits their power
Leaders assert their rights regardless of God’s will
Leaders seek personal glory over God’s commands
Leaders ignore God’s instructions to maintain control
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders obey God’s word even when it limits their power
questions.explanation: Rehoboam obeyed God’s command not to fight and returned peacefully (2 Chronicles 11:2-4), demonstrating humility and contentment with God’s plan over personal ambition.

questions.question: Based on 2 Chronicles 11, what principle about generosity and provision in family and community life can be learned?
options: Provide abundantly for those under your care
Ignore the needs of family members
questions.correctAnswer: Provide abundantly for those under your care
questions.explanation: Verse 23 describes Rehoboam giving victuals in abundance to his children in the cities, illustrating generous provision as wise stewardship.

questions.question: How does the chapter illustrate the importance of spiritual fellowship and unity?
options: Believers from all tribes came to Jerusalem to seek the LORD together
Individuals should worship alone without others
Separate from those who do not share your views
questions.correctAnswer: Believers from all tribes came to Jerusalem to seek the LORD together
questions.explanation: Verses 16-17 show people from all Israel seeking God in Jerusalem, strengthening the kingdom through unity in worship and faith.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Rehoboam loved __________ the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and concubines.
questions.correctAnswer: Maachah
questions.explanation: Verse 21 states that Rehoboam loved Maachah, daughter of Absalom, above all other wives and concubines, highlighting a family relationship with significance.

questions.question: What does Rehoboam’s example of having many wives and children teach us about biblical family responsibility?
options: Raising a large family requires wise leadership and provision
Having many children means ignoring their needs
Favoritism is necessary in family leadership
Family size is unimportant to spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: Raising a large family requires wise leadership and provision
questions.explanation: Verses 21-23 describe Rehoboam’s many wives and children and how he distributed responsibilities and provision among them, showing the need for wise family stewardship.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 11 guide believers in perseverance through trials and maintaining faith?
options: Walking in the ways of David and Solomon strengthens faith over time
Giving up in difficult times is acceptable
Avoid seeking God when facing problems
questions.correctAnswer: Walking in the ways of David and Solomon strengthens faith over time
questions.explanation: Verse 17 notes that for three years they walked in the way of David and Solomon, strengthening the kingdom and faith through perseverance and obedience.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 11.

questions.question: What was the number of chosen warriors that Rehoboam gathered from Judah and Benjamin to fight against Israel?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:1 states that Rehoboam gathered an hundred and fourscore thousand (180,000) chosen men who were warriors.

questions.question: Who delivered the word of the LORD to Rehoboam, instructing him not to fight against Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Shemaiah the man of God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:2 identifies Shemaiah as the man of God who received and delivered the LORD's word to Rehoboam.

questions.question: What command did the LORD give through Shemaiah concerning the conflict with Israel?
options: Do not go up nor fight against your brethren
questions.correctAnswer: Do not go up nor fight against your brethren
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:4 records the LORD's command that Rehoboam and the people should not fight their brethren but return to their homes.

questions.question: Which city was NOT mentioned as one of the fortified cities built by Rehoboam?
questions.correctAnswer: Jericho
questions.explanation: Jericho is not listed among the cities fortified by Rehoboam in 2 Chronicles 11:6-10; Bethlehem, Etam, and Tekoa are mentioned.

questions.question: What items did Rehoboam provide in every city to strengthen the defense, according to the text?
questions.correctAnswer: Shields and spears
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:12 states that Rehoboam put shields and spears in every city to make them exceedingly strong.

questions.question: Why did the priests and Levites from all Israel come to Rehoboam in Judah?
options: Because Jeroboam had cast them off from the priest's office
questions.correctAnswer: Because Jeroboam had cast them off from the priest's office
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:14 explains that the Levites left their possessions because Jeroboam and his sons had excluded them from priestly duties.

questions.question: What did Jeroboam ordain for the high places, which was criticized in 2 Chronicles 11?
options: Priests for the devils and calves he had made
questions.correctAnswer: Priests for the devils and calves he had made
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:15 mentions Jeroboam appointing priests for high places and for the idols (devils and calves) he had made.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 11, how long did Judah strengthen Rehoboam’s kingdom because they walked in the ways of David and Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: Three years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:17 states that Rehoboam was strong for three years because they walked in the way of David and Solomon.

questions.question: Who was the daughter of Absalom that Rehoboam loved above all his wives and concubines?
questions.correctAnswer: Maachah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:20-21 identifies Maachah, daughter of Absalom, as the wife whom Rehoboam loved above all others.

questions.question: How many wives and concubines did Rehoboam have according to the chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: 18 wives and 60 concubines
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:21 notes that Rehoboam took eighteen wives and threescore (60) concubines.

questions.question: Who was made chief among Rehoboam's sons and considered for kingship?
questions.correctAnswer: Abijah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:22 states that Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah chief to be ruler among his brethren.

questions.question: What strategy did Rehoboam use to strengthen his control over Judah and Benjamin regarding his children?
options: Dispersed them throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin
Sent them as ambassadors to Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Dispersed them throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:23 explains that Rehoboam wisely dispersed his children to every fenced city in Judah and Benjamin.

questions.question: True or False: The people obeyed the LORD’s command not to fight their brethren and returned from going against Jeroboam.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:4 records that they obeyed the LORD's words and returned from attacking Jeroboam.

questions.question: The building and fortification of cities by Rehoboam in 2 Chronicles 11 reflect which broader biblical theme?
options: The establishment of security and order as a sign of God's blessing
questions.correctAnswer: The establishment of security and order as a sign of God's blessing
questions.explanation: The fortification of cities (2 Chronicles 11:5-12) reflects a common biblical theme where security and stability are signs of divine favor and righteous rule.

questions.question: What intertextual connection can be drawn between Rehoboam’s strengthening of Judah and the reign of his grandfather David?
options: Both kings sought to unify and fortify the kingdom
Both kings neglected the temple worship
Both kings ruled only over Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: Both kings sought to unify and fortify the kingdom
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:17 references that for three years Judah walked in the ways of David and Solomon, implying Rehoboam’s efforts mirrored David’s unifying and fortifying reign.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the initial military action Rehoboam took upon arriving in Jerusalem according to 2 Chronicles 11?
options: He gathered 180,000 warriors from Judah and Benjamin to fight Israel
He immediately sought peace with Jeroboam
He sent envoys to Egypt for assistance
He fortified Jerusalem without assembling troops
questions.correctAnswer: He gathered 180,000 warriors from Judah and Benjamin to fight Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:1 describes Rehoboam gathering one hundred and eighty thousand chosen warriors from Judah and Benjamin to fight Israel, aiming to restore his kingdom. This demonstrates his initial reliance on military power before divine intervention. Similarly, biblical leaders often initially rely on military strength (e.g., David in 2 Samuel 5:3-4), but God’s sovereignty over war and peace is paramount (Exodus 14:14, Proverbs 21:31, James 4:1-2).

questions.question: Who delivered God's command to Rehoboam not to fight against Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Shemaiah the man of God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:2-3 records that the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, instructing him to tell Rehoboam and the people of Judah and Benjamin not to fight against their brethren, Israel. This divine intervention emphasizes God's sovereignty in preserving unity among His people. Prophets often served as God's mouthpiece (1 Kings 22:7-8; Jeremiah 1:9; Amos 3:7; Acts 3:22).

questions.question: What reason did God give for forbidding Rehoboam to fight his brethren?
options: Because this division was done by God’s will
Because Israel was too strong to defeat
Because Rehoboam was not ready for war
Because Jeroboam had made peace offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Because this division was done by God’s will
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 11:4, God declares that the division of the kingdom was His doing, instructing Rehoboam not to fight his brethren. This underlines God's control over political events and His providence in the unfolding of salvation history, showing that human conflicts can serve divine purposes (Isaiah 45:1-7; Romans 8:28; Proverbs 16:4; Daniel 4:35).

questions.question: What strategic approach did Rehoboam take to strengthen Judah after the military threat was averted?
options: He built and fortified cities for defense throughout Judah
He sent envoys to Egypt for an alliance
He established new altars for worship
He disbanded his army and sought peace
questions.correctAnswer: He built and fortified cities for defense throughout Judah
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 11:5-12, Rehoboam built and fortified numerous cities in Judah and Benjamin, establishing strongholds and placing captains with supplies and weapons. This reflects an emphasis on prudent governance and reliance on God’s protection through preparation (Nehemiah 4:14; Proverbs 21:31; Psalm 18:2; Ephesians 6:10-18).

questions.question: Which cities did Rehoboam build or fortify as mentioned in the chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Bethlehem, Etam, Tekoa
questions.explanation: Verses 6-10 list several cities Rehoboam fortified, including Bethlehem, Etam, and Tekoa. These cities were strategically important in Judah and Benjamin. This reflects the biblical theme of God’s people securing their inheritance through wise stewardship (Joshua 15:59; Nehemiah 3:1-32; 2 Kings 14:7; Psalm 127:1).

questions.question: What role did Rehoboam assign to the captains in the fortified cities?
options: To guard the strongholds and manage supplies of victuals, oil, and wine
To lead worship and teach the law
To negotiate peace with neighboring kingdoms
questions.correctAnswer: To guard the strongholds and manage supplies of victuals, oil, and wine
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:11 shows that Rehoboam appointed captains to oversee fortified cities and store victuals, oil, and wine, ensuring preparedness. This illustrates responsible leadership and reliance on God’s provision, paralleling biblical instructions for stewardship and readiness (Exodus 16:35; Nehemiah 7:70; Proverbs 21:20; Luke 14:28-30).

questions.question: What was the significance of the priests and Levites coming to Rehoboam in Judah and Jerusalem?
options: They were rejected by Jeroboam and sought to serve the LORD in Judah
They wanted to join Rehoboam’s military forces
They sought to establish new high places for worship
questions.correctAnswer: They were rejected by Jeroboam and sought to serve the LORD in Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:13-14 explains that priests and Levites left their lands because Jeroboam and his sons prevented them from serving God properly, so they came to Judah where worship was preserved. This highlights the importance of proper priestly ministry and faithful worship in God’s covenant community (Leviticus 10:10; 1 Chronicles 23:3-5; Hebrews 7:11-14; John 4:23-24).

questions.question: What sin did Jeroboam commit concerning the priesthood, as noted in this chapter?
options: He ordained priests for high places and for idols like calves
He refused to appoint any priests at all
He destroyed the temple in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: He ordained priests for high places and for idols like calves
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states Jeroboam ordained priests for high places and for the calves he had made, which were idols, showing disobedience to God's command for worship. This is a key example of syncretism and false worship condemned throughout Scripture (Exodus 32:1-6; 1 Kings 12:28-30; Isaiah 44:9-20; Galatians 1:8-9).

questions.question: Who among the tribes of Israel came to Jerusalem to seek the LORD according to 2 Chronicles 11?
options: Those who set their hearts to seek the LORD God of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Those who set their hearts to seek the LORD God of Israel
questions.explanation: Verse 16 states that people from all tribes who truly sought the LORD God of Israel came to Jerusalem to sacrifice, emphasizing genuine devotion transcending political division. This reflects the biblical principle that worship is a matter of the heart (Deuteronomy 6:5; Psalm 24:3-4; John 4:23-24; Hebrews 11:6).

questions.question: For how many years did Rehoboam’s kingdom remain strong as a result of walking in the ways of David and Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: Three years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 11:17 states that Rehoboam was strong for three years as they walked in the ways of David and Solomon, highlighting the blessings and stability that come from faithfulness to God. This aligns with the biblical theme that obedience leads to blessing (Deuteronomy 28:1-14; Psalm 1:1-3; Proverbs 3:1-2; John 15:10-11).

questions.question: Who was Mahalath, and what was her relationship to Rehoboam?
options: Daughter of Jerimoth and wife of Rehoboam
Daughter of Absalom and concubine of Rehoboam
Sister of Solomon and mother of Rehoboam’s heir
questions.correctAnswer: Daughter of Jerimoth and wife of Rehoboam
questions.explanation: Verse 18 identifies Mahalath as the daughter of Jerimoth, son of David, and a wife of Rehoboam. This illustrates royal alliances and continuity of Davidic lineage, important for messianic expectations (2 Samuel 3:2-5; 1 Chronicles 3:1-24; Luke 1:32-33; Romans 1:3).

questions.question: How many wives and concubines did Rehoboam have, and how many children did he father?
questions.correctAnswer: 18 wives, 60 concubines, 28 sons, and 60 daughters
questions.explanation: Verse 21 states that Rehoboam took eighteen wives and sixty concubines, fathering twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters. This reflects the polygamous practices of many Old Testament kings and the complexity of royal households (Genesis 16:1-3; 2 Samuel 5:13; 1 Kings 11:3; Psalm 127:3-5).

questions.question: Who did Rehoboam appoint as chief among his sons, and for what purpose?
options: Abijah, to be ruler among his brethren and to be king
questions.correctAnswer: Abijah, to be ruler among his brethren and to be king
questions.explanation: Verse 22 reveals Rehoboam made Abijah, son of Maachah, chief among his brothers, intending to make him king. This illustrates dynastic succession consistent with biblical promises of David’s line (2 Samuel 7:12-16; 1 Chronicles 28:5; Matthew 1:1; Luke 1:32).

questions.question: How did Rehoboam manage his children in regard to the territories of Judah and Benjamin?
options: He dispersed them throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin to fortified cities with abundant provisions
He kept them all in Jerusalem as advisors
He sent them to Egypt for education
He appointed them as priests in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: He dispersed them throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin to fortified cities with abundant provisions
questions.explanation: Verse 23 explains Rehoboam wisely distributed his children to various fortified cities with abundant victuals, likely to secure loyalty and governance. This reflects biblical patterns of delegation and stewardship (Exodus 18:17-23; 1 Kings 4:2-6; Proverbs 11:14; Titus 1:5).

questions.question: What does Rehoboam’s desire for many wives indicate about his reign as portrayed in this chapter?
options: It reflects earthly pursuit of power and alliance, but contrasts with God's ideal for marriage
It shows his obedience to God's command to multiply
It was a sign of divine blessing and favor
It indicates his rejection of Davidic tradition
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects earthly pursuit of power and alliance, but contrasts with God's ideal for marriage
questions.explanation: Verse 23 mentions his desire for many wives, demonstrating political and social strategies common in monarchies but contrasting with the biblical ideal of monogamous covenant marriage (Genesis 2:24; Malachi 2:14; Matthew 19:4-6; 1 Timothy 3:2). Polygamy often led to complications and disobedience (Genesis 16; 2 Samuel 13).
